page.title: 10FARMING.
page.content: Most farmers have sheep and cattle in this area.Sheep lamb in spring. Farmers usually dip twice a year but they can dip three times a year.Most farmers buy cattle at a young age and sell at 10 to 12 months old.They are usually all sold at local markets around Powys but they might be sold in Hereford. In the summer farmers let the grass grow long and in winter they keep the grass as hay when it is in bales or silage. There is about 2.5 acres to a hectare. Some people with farms have horses although not many have shire horses around this area. The main two tractors are "David Brown" and "Ferguson".
